subprocess_flow.description: The Inventory Management Team receives the stock-out report from the sales associate, either manually or electronically.
success_criteria: Stock-out report is successfully received by the Inventory Management Team.

subprocess_flow.description: The Inventory Management Team checks the back stock area for the product identified in the stock-out report.
success_criteria: Back stock area has been thoroughly checked for the product.

subprocess_flow.description: If the product is not found in the back stock, the Inventory Management Team re-verifies the stock-out location on the sales floor to ensure the initial report was accurate and that no remaining items are present.
success_criteria: Sales floor location has been re-verified for the product.

subprocess_flow.description: The Inventory Management Team verifies the inventory levels in the Inventory Management System to confirm the stock-out and check for any discrepancies between physical inventory and system records.
success_criteria: Inventory levels in the system have been verified against the physical inventory.

subprocess_flow.description: Based on the physical inventory checks and system record verification, the Inventory Management Team confirms whether a true stock-out has occurred.
success_criteria: A decision has been made whether the reported issue is a valid stock-out.

subprocess_flow.description: If the stock-out is confirmed, the Inventory Management Team documents all relevant details, including product ID, quantity out of stock, time of occurrence, potential causes (if known), and the sales associate who reported the stock-out. They should also note the verification steps taken.
success_criteria: Complete and accurate documentation of the stock-out details.

subprocess_flow.description: The verified stock-out documentation is stored in the designated location (either physical or electronic) for later review and analysis.
success_criteria: Stock-out documentation is stored in the correct location and is easily accessible.
